metadata.feature_description: Complete folder lifecycle management including creation, deletion, moving, and synchronization with permission controls

steps.actual: Assets panel opened successfully with Home folder view

steps.actual: Add folder dialog appeared with Name and Type fields

steps.expected: Folder is created and appears in folder list
steps.actual: Folder 'TestFolder_SingleCreate' was created successfully and appeared in the folder list

steps.expected: View changes to show contents of TestFolder_SingleCreate
steps.actual: Breadcrumb showed Home > TestFolder_SingleCreate and folder contents displayed

steps.expected: Nested folder is created inside TestFolder_SingleCreate
steps.actual: SubFolder_Level1 was created successfully inside TestFolder_SingleCreate

steps.expected: Add folder dialog appears
steps.actual: Add folder dialog appeared

steps.action: Enter folder name with invalid characters 'Invalid:Folder*Name' and click Save

steps.actual: System displayed error: 'The name contains invalid character(s). Please specify a name without \:/*?"<>|.'

steps.expected: Action buttons (edit, move, delete) appear on hover
steps.actual: Action buttons appeared on hover over the folder card

steps.expected: Delete confirmation dialog appears
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared asking 'Are you sure you want to delete the folder SubFolder_Level1?'

steps.action: Confirm deletion by clicking Delete button
steps.expected: Folder is deleted and removed from list
steps.actual: SubFolder_Level1 was deleted successfully and removed from the folder list

steps.expected: ContentToDelete folder is created
steps.actual: ContentToDelete folder was created successfully inside TestFolder_SingleCreate

steps.actual: Delete confirmation dialog appeared asking about deleting TestFolder_SingleCreate

steps.expected: Folder and all contents are deleted
steps.actual: TestFolder_SingleCreate and its subfolder ContentToDelete were both deleted successfully

steps.actual: MoveTestFolder was created successfully in Home folder

steps.actual: Move dialog appeared showing folder tree with 'Move folder to (select a destination)' title

steps.expected: Folder is moved to Images folder
steps.actual: MoveTestFolder was successfully moved to Images folder and appeared in the Images folder contents

steps.expected: Home folder view is displayed with sync button visible
steps.actual: Home folder displayed with 'Sync this folder and subfolders' button visible in toolbar

steps.action: Click 'Sync this folder and subfolders' button
steps.expected: Folder contents are synchronized with file system
steps.actual: Synchronization completed successfully - folder view refreshed showing current state

steps.action: Click Add Folder and examine Type dropdown
steps.expected: Multiple folder types are available (Standard, Secure, Database, cloud storage)
steps.actual: Type dropdown showed 5 options: Standard, Secure, Database, Box_639024605374476375, Dropbox_639024623698967086

steps.action: Click on Type dropdown to expand options
steps.expected: All folder mapping options are visible
steps.actual: Dropdown expanded showing all available folder types with Standard highlighted as default

steps.expected: Secure folder is created with appropriate visual indicator
steps.actual: SecureFolderTest was created with a lock icon on the folder, indicating secure storage type

observations: Folder deletion is recursive - deleting a folder with contents removes all subfolders and files without requiring individual confirmation for each item
The folder move feature uses a tree-based destination selector that shows all available folders in the site
Synchronization refreshes the folder view to match the file system state - useful when files are added outside of the UI
Folder mapping supports multiple storage types: Standard (file system), Secure (encrypted storage), Database, and cloud providers (Box, Dropbox)
Secure folders are visually distinguished with a lock icon overlay on the folder thumbnail

The 'unlinking' feature mentioned in the code (UnlinkAllowedStatus) applies specifically to folders mapped to external cloud storage providers - testing would require configured cloud storage credentials
Invalid folder name characters (\:/*?"<>|) are properly validated with clear error messaging
